intro: Stanfieldiella imperforata var. imperforata, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandmat, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically smooth and without teeth or lobes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, and it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water availability.
